question: How to create a subject?
answer: To create a subject, go to the Admin panel and click on 'Create Subject'. You will need to provide the Subject Name, Subject Code, Department (EE, ECE, CSE, IT), Semester (1st to 8th), Location (Latitude and Longitude), and any Time Slots for the classes.

question: How to create a quiz?
answer: To create a quiz, navigate to a specific subject in the Admin panel. Click on 'Create Quiz' for that subject. Enter the Quiz Title, Submission Date, Duration in minutes, Marks per Question, and the Total number of Questions. You can then manually add questions, generate them using AI, or import them from an XML file.

question: What departments are supported?
answer: The website currently supports Electrical Engineering (EE), Electronics & Communication (ECE), Computer Science (CSE), and Information Technology (IT).

question: Can I use AI to generate questions?
answer: Yes! When creating a quiz, you can use the 'Generate with AI' button. You can even upload lecture notes or paste text to provide context for the AI to generate relevant questions.

question: How do I import questions from a file?
answer: You can import questions using the 'Upload XML' button in the Quiz Creator Studio. The XML should follow a specific format with 'question', 'text', 'option', and 'correctAnswer' tags.

question: How do I take a quiz?
answer: To take a quiz, log in as a student, navigate to your subjects, and look for available quizzes. Click on a quiz to start it. Note that the quiz will open in full-screen mode and switching tabs is monitored.

question: What are the rules for taking a quiz?
answer: Quizzes are taken in full-screen mode. Right-click, copy-paste, and DevTools are disabled. Switching tabs more than 10 times will result in automatic submission of the quiz.

question: How does attendance work?
answer: Attendance is taken using an OTP and location verification. Teachers enable attendance (Live Mode) and provide an OTP valid for 5 minutes. Students must be within the specified classroom location and enter the correct OTP to be marked present.

question: Can teachers mark attendance manually?
answer: Yes, teachers can manually mark students as Present or Absent using the 'Mark Attendance' popup in the Attendance Sheet. This is useful for offline attendance or correcting errors.

question: What is the difference between Live and Offline attendance?
answer: In 'Live' mode, students can mark their own attendance using an OTP. In 'Offline' mode, the teacher must manually mark attendance for each student.

question: How do I export attendance data?
answer: In the Attendance Sheet, click the 'Export Data' button to download the attendance records as an Excel file (.xlsx).

question: Where can I find study materials or notes?
answer: You can find study materials in the 'Notes' section of each subject. Teachers upload PDFs and images related to the course content there.

question: What are Study Rooms?
answer: Study Rooms are collaborative spaces where students and teachers can interact. They can be public or private, allowing members to share resources and discuss topics.

question: How do I submit an assignment?
answer: To submit an assignment, go to the 'Assignments' section of the relevant subject. Select the assignment, upload your file (PDF or image), and click submit.

question: What file types can I upload for assignments?
answer: You can upload most common file types, but PDFs are recommended as they can be easily previewed within the application.

question: How do teachers view assignment submissions?
answer: Teachers can click 'Submissions' on an assignment to view a list of student submissions. They can preview files directly or download all submissions as a ZIP file.

question: How do I join an online meeting or class?
answer: If a teacher schedules a meeting, it will appear in the 'Meetings' section. You can join the session directly from there using the provided link.

question: Where can I see my quiz results and weakness analysis?
answer: After completing a quiz, you can view your score in the 'Results' section. The 'Weakness Analysis' feature helps you identify which topics you need to focus on based on your performance.

question: How do I receive updates and notifications?
answer: The platform sends notifications for new quizzes, assignments, study materials, and messages. You can check these in the 'Notifications' bell icon on your dashboard.

question: How do I know when my assignments are due?
answer: Submission deadlines for assignments are listed in the 'Assignments' section of each subject. You can also see upcoming deadlines on your main dashboard.

question: Can multiple teachers manage a single subject?
answer: Yes, the creator of a subject can invite other teachers. Once the invited teacher accepts, they can also manage the subject, create quizzes, and upload notes.

question: What is the difference between Teacher and Student roles?
answer: Teachers can create subjects, quizzes, and upload notes. Students can enroll in subjects, take quizzes, download study materials, and submit assignments.

question: How do I know if my account is verified?
answer: Your verification status (Pending, Accepted, or Rejected) is visible on your dashboard. New accounts require admin approval before full access is granted.

question: Does the website track my online status?
answer: Yes, the platform uses real-time presence tracking to show if you are online and your 'Last Seen' time to other members of your subjects.

question: What technologies are used to build this website?
answer: The platform is built using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js) with Auth0 for authentication and Socket.io for real-time collaboration.

question: How do the chat features work?
answer: The real-time chat supports text messages, emoji reactions, @mentions for specific users, and live typing indicators.

question: Where can I access the live website?
answer: You can visit the production version of the website at https://bppimt-quiz.vercel.app.

question: How do I navigate back to the home page?
answer: You can click on the 'Back' button or the 'Home' icon in the navigation bar to return to the main dashboard.

question: What does the progress bar in the Quiz Creator Studio represent?
answer: The progress bar shows how much of your quiz setup is complete. It factors in basic info, questions, and options to help you ensure everything is ready before submission.

question: Can I use external notes for AI quiz generation?
answer: Yes! You can upload PDF, Word, or PPT files in the Quiz Creator Studio, and the AI will use the content from those notes to generate relevant questions.

question: What is the 'Magic' AI button for?
answer: The 'Generate with AI' button uses the Gemini AI service to automatically create quiz questions based on your title and any provided context or uploaded notes.

question: How do I import a large number of questions at once?
answer: Teachers can use the 'Upload XML' feature to bulk-import questions. The XML system parses question text, options, and correct answers automatically.

question: Can I remove a question I've already added to a quiz?
answer: Yes, each question card has a 'Remove' button that allows you to delete it before you finalize and create the quiz.

question: How do I search for a specific message in the Community Chat?
answer: Use the search icon in the chat header. You can type keywords to find past messages, and use the up/down arrows to jump between results.

question: Can I pin important messages in the chat?
answer: Yes, teachers have the ability to pin important messages. Pinned messages appear at the top of the chat for everyone to see.

question: What are the typing indicators in the chat?
answer: Typing indicators show you in real-time when other users are currently composing a message in the channel.

question: How do I reply to a specific message?
answer: Hover over a message and click the 'Reply' icon. Your message will then be linked to the original one, helping keep conversations organized.

question: What do the emoji reactions in the chat do?
answer: You can react to messages with emojis to show support, agreement, or other sentiments without typing a full response.

question: How do I download all assignment submissions?
answer: In the 'Submissions' view of an assignment, teachers can click 'Download All ZIP' to get all student submissions in a single compressed file.

question: Where are the Previous Year Questions (PYQs) stored?
answer: PYQs are organized in a digital archive by Academic Year, Stream, and Semester. You can find them in the 'PYQ' section of the website.

question: How do I verify a quiz certificate?
answer: Go to the 'Certificate Verifier' page and enter the unique Result ID (e.g., QUIZ_12345). The system will check its authenticity and display the student's details.

question: What is the 'Weakness Quiz' feature?
answer: The 'Weakness Quiz' generates a personalized quiz focusing specifically on the topics you struggled with in previous attempts to help you improve.

question: Can I see who else is online?
answer: Yes, the 'Online Users' bar in the chat section shows all currently active members of the college community.

question: What is the 'Calendar' used for?
answer: The 'Quiz Calendar' shows all upcoming and past quizzes. It helps you stay organized and see what evaluations are scheduled for your department and semester.

question: How do I join a Study Room?
answer: Navigate to the 'Study Rooms' section, browse the available rooms, and click 'Join' or click on a room to see its details and participate in discussions.

question: Can I upload images as my profile picture?
answer: Yes, the platform uses Auth0 for profile management, which supports profile pictures from your linked social accounts or directly uploaded images.

question: What department codes are supported for PYQs?
answer: The archive currently supports CSE (Computer Science), IT (Information Technology), ECE (Electronics & Communication), and EE (Electrical Engineering).

question: How do I download a PYQ paper?
answer: Once you filter by year, stream, and semester, a list of subjects will appear. Click the download icon next to a subject to retrieve the PDF paper.

question: Is there a global chat for the entire college?
answer: Yes, the 'Community Chat' serves as a global space where students and teachers from all departments can interact.

question: What happens if I miss a quiz?
answer: Quizzes have a specific submission date. If you miss it, you should contact your subject teacher to see if a re-attempt or extension is possible.

question: How many marks is each question worth?
answer: Teachers set the 'Marks per Question' during quiz creation. This value is displayed in the quiz details before you start.

question: What is the 'Quiz Creator Studio'?
answer: It is a specialized tool for teachers to design quizzes, featuring manual entry, AI generation, and bulk XML imports.

question: What is the Question Bank?
answer: The Question Bank allows teachers to view all questions associated with a subject. You can search for specific questions or filter by quiz title.

question: Can I edit my messages after sending them?
answer: Yes, you can edit your own chat messages to fix typos or update information.

question: How are results calculated?
answer: Results are calculated automatically based on the number of correct answers and the marks assigned per question by the teacher.

question: What is the 'Result ID'?
answer: A 'Result ID' is a unique code generated for every quiz attempt. It is used to verify the authenticity of your completion certificate.

question: Where can I find the 'About Us' page?
answer: The 'About Us' page is available in the navigation bar and provides information about the platform's mission and team.

question: Is the website mobile-friendly?
answer: Yes, the BPPIMT Quiz Portal is fully responsive and optimized for use on desktops, tablets, and smartphones.

question: Can teachers see my real-time progress?
answer: Teachers can see when you've submitted your quiz and the final result. They do not see your screen in real-time, but tab switching is monitored.

question: What is the 'Last Seen' feature for?
answer: It helps peers and teachers know when a user was last active on the platform, fostering a more connected community.

question: Can I share my certificates on LinkedIn?
answer: Yes, certificates are designed to be shareable achievements that you can use to boost your professional profile.

question: Does the platform use Socket.io?
answer: Yes, Socket.io is used to enable real-time features like chat messaging, typing indicators, and presence tracking.

question: What is 'MERN' stack?
answer: MERN stands for MongoDB, Express, React, and Node.jsâ€”the core technologies used to build this platform.

question: How do I secure my account?
answer: The platform uses Auth0, a secure identity provider, to manage logins. Ensure you use a strong password or multi-factor authentication if available.

question: Can I delete my chat history?
answer: You can delete individual messages you've sent, but the overall chat history remains for the community or subject group.

question: What is the 'Attendance Sheet'?
answer: It is a record of your presence in different classes, tracked via the OTP and location system.

question: How do I find my department and semester?
answer: This information is usually set in your profile during registration and is used to filter quizzes and subjects relevant to you.

question: Can I take a quiz twice?
answer: Standard quizzes are usually single-attempt, but you can always use the 'Weakness Quiz' feature to practice topics multiple times.

question: What are 'Subject Notes'?
answer: These are study materials uploaded by teachers, such as lecture slides or additional readings, found in each subject's module.

question: How do I know if an assignment is overdue?
answer: The deadline will be highlighted, and the system may prevent further uploads or mark them as 'Late' depending on the settings.

question: Who can create Study Rooms?
answer: Both teachers and students can create study rooms to facilitate group learning and resource sharing.

question: What is 'Personalized Recommendation' in quizzes?
answer: Based on your previous performance, the AI suggests specific quizzes or topics you should focus on next.

question: Can I access the platform without an internet connection?
answer: No, the BPPIMT Quiz Portal requires an active internet connection to sync your results and interact with other users.

question: Are there any notifications for upcoming quizzes?
answer: Yes, the notification bell icon will alert you when a new quiz is scheduled for your department.

question: How do I log out of the portal?
answer: Click on your profile avatar or the 'Logout' button in the dashboard to securely end your session.

question: What is 'Smart Suggestions'?
answer: A feature that predicts which study materials or quizzes will be most helpful based on your current subjects and progress.

question: Where can I report a bug or technical issue?
answer: You can contact the admin team or your teacher through the 'Support' or 'Contact Us' sections.

question: Why am I getting 'User not found' error?
answer: This error occurs if your account does not exist or if you are not logged in properly. Please ensure you have signed up and are using the correct email address.

question: What does 'You Not Verified' mean?
answer: It means your email address has not been verified yet. Check your inbox for a verification code or contact an admin to approve your account.

question: Why can't I create a quiz?
answer: If you see 'You are not allowed to create quizzes', it means you are logged in as a Student. Only users with the 'Teacher' role can create quizzes. Also, ensure all required fields like title, date, time, and questions are filled.

question: I got an error 'User already exists' while signing up.
answer: This means there is already an account registered with that email address. Please try logging in instead of signing up.

question: Why am I getting 'Geolocation is not supported'?
answer: Your browser does not support location services, or you have denied permission. Please enable location access in your browser settings to mark attendance.

question: What does 'You are too far from the classroom' mean?
answer: Attendance is location-based. You must be within 100 meters of the classroom's registered coordinates to mark your attendance successfully.

question: Why does it say 'Attendance time is not active'?
answer: You can only mark attendance during the specific day and time slots scheduled by your teacher. Please check the timetable.

question: I see 'Invalid OTP' when trying to give attendance.
answer: The OTP you entered is incorrect. Please ask your teacher for the current 6-digit code displayed on their screen.

question: What does 'OTP has expired' mean?
answer: OTPs are valid for only 5 minutes. If it has expired, please ask your teacher to generate a new one.

question: Why can't I upload my assignment?
answer: If the deadline has passed, or if the file type is not supported, you may face issues. Ensure you are uploading before the due date.

question: I got 'You have already attempted this quiz'.
answer: Quizzes can usually be attempted only once. You cannot submit responses again for the same quiz.

question: Why is my certificate verification failing?
answer: Ensure you are entering the correct 'Result ID'. If it says 'Certificate not found', the ID might be incorrect or the result does not exist.

question: Why can't I view the results?
answer: If you are a student, you might not have permission to view everyone's results. Only teachers can view the full result list for a quiz.

question: What does 'Department and Semester are required' mean?
answer: When signing up as a Student, you must select your valid Department and Semester so we can show you the relevant subjects and quizzes.

question: Why did my quiz auto-submit?
answer: The system monitors tab switching. If you switch tabs more than 10 times, the quiz is automatically submitted to prevent cheating.

question: I keep getting 'Network Error'.
answer: Please check your internet connection. If the issue persists, the server might be down or unreachable.

question: Why can't I see any subjects?
answer: Subjects are filtered by your Department and Semester. If you don't see any, please check your profile settings to ensure they are correct.

question: What does 'Server error' mean?
answer: This is a general error on our end. Please try again later, and if the problem continues, contact support.

question: Why is the 'Generate with AI' button disabled?
answer: You must enter a Quiz Title first. The AI needs a topic to generate questions.

question: I can't find the 'Delete' button for a quiz.
answer: Only the teacher who created the quiz (or an admin) can delete it. Students cannot delete quizzes.

question: Why do I see 'DevTools is not allowed'?
answer: To prevent cheating during quizzes, opening Developer Tools is strictly prohibited.

question: What does 'You are not authorized to update this quiz' mean?
answer: Only the teacher who created the quiz is allowed to edit or reschedule it.

question: Why do I see 'No file uploaded' when submitting homework?
answer: You must select a valid file before clicking the submit button.

question: What does 'Another subject with the same details already exists' mean?
answer: You are trying to create a subject that has the same name, department, semester, and code as an existing one. Please check the details or ask to be added to the existing subject.

question: Why do I see 'Attendance is currently disabled by the teacher'?
answer: The teacher has turned off the attendance toggle for this session. Please ask them to enable it if you need to mark attendance.
